question_text: Two monitors both support 4K resolution, but one is 27 inches and the other is 65 inches. What effect does this difference have?
answer_options: The 65-inch display will be sharper due to more pixels
The 27-inch display will have a higher pixel density
Both displays have identical pixel density
The 65-inch display will consume less power
correct_answer: The 27-inch display will have a higher pixel density
explanation: Pixel density (PPI) is higher on the smaller screen because the same number of pixels are packed into a smaller space, making images sharper.
